page.title: 10ROADS INTO SEDGEFIELD
page.content: Many of the people in{Sedgefield work outside the village.{Durham { City,Darlington and Teesside}being larger centres of employment than the village itself. The village has no railway Station but is served by regular bus services run by the{"National"}bus company,and by a local firm from Trimdon{"T.M.S." Many local commuters use their own cars.Sedgefield is at the intersection of the{A689 and A177}both dual carriageways for at least part of their way. The{A689}gives easy access to the {A1(M)}three miles west of Sedgefield and the{A19}seven miles east of Sedgefield.The{A1(M)}provides easy access to areas north and south .The {A177}connects Durham and Stockton
